lst.map: hazusData path None Defines the location of the hazus building config data file. True
stdStiffness float None Defines the standard deviation that should be considered when sampling the stiffness for the building. True
stdDamping float None Defines the standard deviation that should be considered when sampling the damping ratio for the building. True

map.str: Creates SAM.json file and generates script for creating a hysteretic multi-degree of freedom (MDOF) system subject to earthquake time history analysis, based on the Lu method. Analysis is executed by the OpenSeesSimulation application.
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the outputted SAM
Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSees structural model. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesSimulation application.
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the outputted SAM

lst.map: modelPath path None Defines the location of the OpenSeesPy model files. True
mainScript string None Defines the name of the main model file. True
ndm int None Defines the number of degrees of freedom in the numerical model. True

dofMap string None The workflow assumes X=1, Y=2, Z=3 mapping between directions and degrees of freedom; XY being the horizontal directions. This input allows you to define an alternative mapping by providing three numbers separated by commas in a string, such as '1, 3, 2' if you want to have Y as the vertical direction. True
ctrlNodes string None Defines the ids of the control nodes that shall be used for EDP calculations. Only the firsts n+1 nodes will be used for an n-story building. True

map.str: Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSeesPy structural model. The functions 'build_model' and 'run_analysis' must be defined in the model script. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesPySimulation application.
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the SAM
name of file containing the EDP to be determined from the analysis

Creates EDP.json file containing standard EDPs for earthquake hazard events, including peak interstory drift ratio (PID), peak floor acceleration (PFA), peak roof drift (PRD), and peak floor displacement (PFD).
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the SAM
name of file containing the EDP to be determined from the analysis

lst.map: EDPspecs path None Identifies the location of a json file that specifies the requested EDPs. True

Returns the input event IM as the EDP in the absence of a response simulation method. This application is appropriate to use when damages and losses are estimated as function of IM in the DL assessment.
name of file containing the BIM
name of file containing the SAM
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the event data
name of file containing the simulation driver
name of EDP file to be added to

lst.map: method string None Defines the UQ method to use. True
samples int None Specifies the number of realizations to generate. For surrogate models, these samples are used to train the model. True
samples2 int None Only for surrogate models. Specifies the number of realizations to generate from the trained model. True
seed int None Specifies the random seed. True
seed2 int None Only for surrogate models. Specifies the random seed to generate samples from the models. True
ismethod string None Specifies the importance sampling method. True
dataMethod string None ... True
dataMethod2 string None ... True
type string None ... True
concurrency int None Specifies the number of processes to use for simulation. True
keepSamples bool None True if the intermediate results shall be kept for each sample. True
runType string None ... True

map.str: Uses the uncertainty quantification package Dakota to sample random variables and execute the workflow driver file.
name of file containing the DL model information
name of file containing the EDP data
name of file to store response estimates
name of file to store damage estimates
name of DV file to store decision variable estimates

lst.map: DL_Method string None Defines the damage and loss assessment method. True
Realizations int None Specifies the number of realizations to generate True
detailed_results bool None If false, only the main results are saved to improve performance. True
log_file bool None If false, pelicun does not create a log file. True
coupled_EDP bool None If true, the raw EDPs are used as-is without re-sampling. True
event_time string None Defines the time of the event in YYYY-MM-DD:HH format. 'off' turns all time-effects off. True
ground_failure bool None If true, fragility groups associated with ground failure are added in the auto-population phase. Note that such analysis requires PGD values as inputs. True
auto_script path None Identifies the location of a python script that can be used to auto-populate the loss model. True

map.str: Performs damage and loss (DL) assessment using the pelicun Python package. The application uses built-in fragility functions and the replacement cost defined in the building source file to determine damage state and loss likelihoods.
Name of JSON file containing an array of id,filename pairs. For each building id the aplication creates a BIM file with name filename

lst.map: filenameEVENTgrid path None Path to file containing location information on each event file True
samples int None Number of event samples to use (interesting when using more than one neighbors) True
neighbors int None Number of neighbors to consider for each asset. True
filter_label string None Custom label to use for pre-selection of grid points True

map.str: Assigns events to building site by sampling from nearest neighboring event sites, using coordinate locations. The user specifies the number of sampled events and the number of neighbors to sample events from.
